content:
TITLE: Docker Commands for Managing Agent Zero
DESCRIPTION: This collection of Docker commands is used to manage the Agent Zero application, including stopping, removing, and running a new container. These commands ensure that any updates or changes in the container environment do not affect the data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker stop agent-zero
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker rm agent-zero
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker rmi frdel/agent-zero-run
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -p $PORT:80 -v /path/to/your/data:/a0 frdel/agent-zero-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Local Agent Zero Instance - Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet runs the Agent Zero application with a web interface by executing the Python script 'run_ui.py'. After running this command, users are instructed to open the displayed URL in a web browser to access Agent Zero's interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Launching Agent Zero Web UI using Python
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Agent Zero Web UI. It should be run from the Agent Zero directory after activating the conda environment if one is being used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/quickstart.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_ui.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Agent Zero with Docker
DESCRIPTION: This Bash snippet demonstrates how to pull and run the Agent Zero Docker image on your local machine. It requires Docker to be installed and running. By executing these commands, you will start the Agent Zero AI framework on port 50001, accessible via a web browser at http://localhost:50001.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/github_readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull and run with Docker

docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run
docker run -p 50001:80 frdel/agent-zero-run

# Visit http://localhost:50001 to start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Running Agent Zero with Docker
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to pull and run the Agent Zero Docker image. It includes commands to download the image and start a container, making the Agent Zero interface accessible via a web browser.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull and run with Docker

docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run
docker run -p 50001:80 frdel/agent-zero-run

# Visit http://localhost:50001 to start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Structuring Response Tool Call in JSON for Agent-Zero Project
DESCRIPTION: This JSON structure demonstrates how to use the 'response' tool to provide a final answer to the user and end task processing. It includes a 'thoughts' array for reasoning, 'tool_name' set to 'response', and 'tool_args' with a 'text' field containing the answer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.response.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "response",
    "tool_args": {
        "text": "Answer to the user",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Agent Zero Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Agent Zero Docker container, mapping a port and mounting a local directory for data persistence. Replace $PORT with the desired port number and /path/to/your/data with the local directory path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -p $PORT:80 -v /path/to/your/data:/a0 frdel/agent-zero-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Agent Zero Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Agent Zero Docker container with port mapping and volume mounting for data persistence
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -p $PORT:80 -v /path/to/your/data:/a0 frdel/agent-zero-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Python Code with Code Execution Tool
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the code execution tool to run Python code. It imports the os module and prints the current working directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.code_exe.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "Need to do...",
        "I can use...",
        "Then I can...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "code_execution_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "runtime": "python",
        "session": 0,
        "code": "import os\nprint(os.getcwd())",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Agent Zero Docker Image
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the Agent Zero Docker image from the Docker Hub repository. This is an alternative to using the Docker Desktop GUI for pulling the image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Memories with Query and Filters in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the memory_load tool to search and retrieve memories based on a query, threshold, limit, and filter. It returns memory content as metadata key-value pairs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.memory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "Let's search my memory for...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "memory_load",
    "tool_args": {
        "query": "File compression library for...",
        "threshold": 0.6,
        "limit": 5,
        "filter": "area=='main' and timestamp<'2024-01-01 00:00:00'",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Agent Zero Docker Image
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the Agent Zero Docker image from Docker Hub repository
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Image Data for LLM using vision_load Tool in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the vision_load tool to load image data into an LLM. The tool takes a 'paths' argument which should contain the file path(s) to the image(s) to be loaded. This is typically used when an agent needs to process or analyze visual information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tools_vision.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "I need to see the image...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "vision_load",
    "tool_args": {
        "paths": ["/path/to/image.png"],
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Terminal Command with Code Execution Tool
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the code execution tool to run a terminal command. It demonstrates installing the 'zip' package using apt-get.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.code_exe.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "Need to do...",
        "Need to install...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "code_execution_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "runtime": "terminal",
        "session": 0,
        "code": "apt-get install zip",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ollama on macOS using Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: This snippet installs Ollama on macOS using the Homebrew package manager. Ensure you have Homebrew installed on your system before executing this command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install ollama
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Knowledge Tool Usage Example in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example JSON structure showing how to use the knowledge tool with thoughts and question arguments. The tool processes questions by combining responses from memory and online sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.knowledge.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "knowledge_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "question": "How to...",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ollama on macOS using Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ollama on macOS using the Homebrew package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install ollama
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Usage of webpage_content_tool
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the JSON structure for calling the webpage content tool with a URL parameter. The tool requires a fully qualified URL including http:// or https:// protocol.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.web.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "webpage_content_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "url": "https://...comexample",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling a Model with Ollama
DESCRIPTION: This command pulls a specified language model using Ollama. Replace <model-name> with the desired model, such as 'mistral-large'. Ensure Ollama is correctly installed before running this command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama pull <model-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calling a Subordinate Agent using JSON in Task Delegation System
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the call_subordinate tool to delegate a task to a subordinate agent. It includes the thought process, tool name, and arguments for creating a new subordinate or communicating with an existing one.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.call_sub.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "The result seems to be ok but...",
        "I will ask a coder subordinate to fix..."
    ],
    "tool_name": "call_subordinate",
    "tool_args": {
        "message": "...",
        "reset": "true"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling an Ollama model
DESCRIPTION: Generic command to download a specific model using Ollama. Replace <model-name> with the desired model.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama pull <model-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Agent-Zero Communication Protocol in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the expected JSON structure for communication in the Agent-Zero project. It includes fields for thoughts, reflections, tool name, and tool arguments. Mathematical expressions should use KaTeX delimiters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/reflection/agent.system.main.communication.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "...",
    ],
    "reflection": [
        "...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "name_of_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "arg1": "val1",
        "arg2": "val2"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Downloaded Models with Ollama
DESCRIPTION: This command lists all models that have been downloaded on your system using Ollama. It helps you manage and review the models currently available for use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama list
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Input Tool for Keyboard Input in Agent-Zero
DESCRIPTION: This JSON structure demonstrates how to use the input tool to provide keyboard input for a terminal program. It includes thoughts about the program's prompt and specifies the keyboard input to be sent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.input.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "The program asks for Y/N...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "input",
    "tool_args": {
        "keyboard": "Y",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing a Model with Ollama
DESCRIPTION: This command allows you to remove a specific model that has been downloaded using Ollama. Replace <model-name> with the name of the model you intend to delete.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama rm <model-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Agent Behavior Guidelines in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This Markdown snippet outlines important behavior guidelines for the Agent Zero project, including instructions on task execution, website interaction, and content summarization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/browser_agent.system.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# important
do not overdo task
when told go to website open website and stop
do not interact unless told to
waiting for instructions means ending task as done
accept any cookies do not go to cokkie settings
in page_summary respond with one paragraph of main content plus brief overview of page elements
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing an Ollama model
DESCRIPTION: Command to remove a specific model downloaded with Ollama. Replace <model-name> with the model to be removed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama rm <model-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saving Text to Memory in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the memory_save tool to save text to memory. It returns an ID for the saved memory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.memory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:

```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "I need to memorize...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "memory_save",
    "tool_args": {
        "text": "# To compress...",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Conda Environment for Agent Zero - Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates how to create a new Conda environment named 'a0' with Python version 3.12. It uses the command 'conda create' to set up the environment, and the '-y' flag bypasses confirmation prompts. This is required to isolate the project dependencies from the system Python installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda create -n a0 python=3.12 -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Formatting JSON Response for Successful Solutions in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the expected JSON format for documenting successful technical solutions. It includes problem description and step-by-step solution instructions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/memory.solutions_sum.sys.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  {
    "problem": "Task is to download a video from YouTube. A video URL is specified by the user.",
    "solution": "1. Install yt-dlp library using 'pip install yt-dlp'\n2. Download the video using yt-dlp command: 'yt-dlp YT_URL', replace YT_URL with your video URL."
  }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Conda Environment for Agent Zero
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new Conda environment named 'a0' with Python version 3.12. The '-y' flag automatically confirms any prompts. Ensure Conda is installed and available in your PATH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda create -n a0 python=3.12 -y
```

TITLE: Formatting Successful Solutions in JSON for Agent Assistance
DESCRIPTION: This JSON structure demonstrates how to format successful technical solutions, including problem description and step-by-step instructions for solving the problem. It includes details such as library installation and command execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.memory.hist_suc.sys.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  {
    "problem": "Task is to download a video from YouTube. A video URL is specified by the user.",
    "solution": "1. Install yt-dlp library using 'pip install yt-dlp'\n2. Download the video using yt-dlp command: 'yt-dlp YT_URL', replace YT_URL with your video URL."
  }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating Conda Environment - Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to activate the newly created Conda environment 'a0'. The command 'conda activate a0' changes the terminal's context, allowing all subsequent package installations to occur within the new environment. This is crucial for maintaining project dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda activate a0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Waiting for Output from Long-Running Scripts
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to use the code execution tool to wait for output from long-running scripts. It uses the 'output' runtime to check for program completion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.code_exe.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "Waiting for program to finish...",
    ],
    "tool_name": "code_execution_tool",
    "tool_args": {
        "runtime": "output",
        "session": 0,
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating Conda Environment
DESCRIPTION: Activates the 'a0' Conda environment in the current terminal session. The prompt should change to indicate the active environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda activate a0
```

TITLE: Generating Search Queries from User Messages in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the expected input-output format for the AI system. It shows how the AI should interpret user messages and generate concise search queries based on the user's intent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/memory.solutions_query.sys.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
"USER": "I want to download a video from YouTube. A video URL is specified by the user.",
"AI": "download youtube video",
"USER": "Now compress all files in that folder",
"AI": "compress files in folder"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Python Requirements from File - Python
DESCRIPTION: This command installs all necessary packages listed in the 'requirements.txt' file using the pip package manager. It ensures that the environment has all the dependencies needed for the Agent Zero project. This process may take some time depending on the number of packages to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example JSON Memory Notes Format
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the expected JSON array format for storing extracted memory notes. Shows how to structure simple facts about a user that are worth remembering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/memory.memories_sum.sys.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  "User's name is John Doe",
  "User's age is 30"
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Python Packages with pip
DESCRIPTION: Installs all required Python packages listed in 'requirements.txt' using pip. Ensure the 'a0' environment is activated when executing this command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Agent-Zero's Process Input Method in Python
DESCRIPTION: This method processes user input, generates a response using AI models, and executes any necessary actions. It handles natural language understanding and task execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.ai_response.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
def process_input(self, user_input):
    # Analyze input and retrieve relevant context
    context = self.memory.get_relevant_context(user_input)
    
    # Generate initial response
    response = self.gpt4.generate_response(user_input, context)
    
    # Plan and execute actions if needed
    if self.task_planner.requires_action(response):
        action_plan = self.task_planner.create_plan(response)
        action_result = self.action_executor.execute_plan(action_plan)
        response += f"\n\nAction taken: {action_result}"
    
    # Update memory
    self.memory.add_interaction(user_input, response)
    
    return response
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing downloaded Ollama models
DESCRIPTION: Command to display a list of all models downloaded using Ollama.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ollama list
```

TITLE: Installing Python dependencies for Agent Zero
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required Python packages for Agent Zero using pip and the requirements.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9


----------------------------------------

TITLE: Forgetting Memories with Query and Filters in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the use of the memory_forget tool to remove memories based on a query, threshold, and filter. It has a default threshold of 0.75 to prevent accidental deletions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.memory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "Let's remove all memories about cars",
    ],
    "tool_name": "memory_forget",
    "tool_args": {
        "query": "cars",
        "threshold": 0.75,
        "filter": "timestamp.startswith('2022-01-01')",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ollama on Linux using curl
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the command to install Ollama on Linux using a shell command with curl. Make sure you have curl installed and the appropriate permissions to execute the command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:


DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to structure a response when there are no more tasks to complete. It includes thoughts, the tool name to be used, and the arguments for that tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.msg_timeout.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "thoughts": [
        "There's no more work for me, I will ask for another task",
    ],
    "tool_name": "task_done",
    "tool_args": {
        "text": "I have no more work, please tell me if you need anything.",
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Ollama on Linux using curl
DESCRIPTION: Command to download and run the Ollama installation script on Linux systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -fsSL https://ollama.com/install.sh | sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting Terminal Session with Code Execution Tool

SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.tool.code_exe.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```

    "thoughts": [
        "code_execution_tool not responding...",
    ],

    }

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding User to Docker Group on Linux
DESCRIPTION: Commands for adding the current user to the docker group and logging in to Docker on Linux systems. This is necessary for using Docker without sudo privileges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker login
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Agent-Zero Class in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the Agent-Zero class, initializing it with various components such as memory, task planner, and model interfaces. It sets up the core structure of the AI assistant.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.ai_response.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
class AgentZero:
    def __init__(self):
        self.memory = Memory()
        self.task_planner = TaskPlanner()
        self.gpt4 = GPT4Interface()
        self.claude = ClaudeInterface()
        self.stable_diffusion = StableDiffusionInterface()
        self.voice = VoiceInterface()
        self.vision = VisionInterface()
        self.action_executor = ActionExecutor()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Agent Zero Docker container
DESCRIPTION: Series of Docker commands to stop, remove, update, and run a new Agent Zero container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Stop the current container
docker stop agent-zero

# Remove the container (data is safe in the folder)
docker rm agent-zero

# Remove the old image
docker rmi frdel/agent-zero-run

# Pull the latest image
docker pull frdel/agent-zero-run

# Run new container with the same volume mount
docker run -p $PORT:80 -v /path/to/your/data:/a0 frdel/agent-zero-run
```

LANGUAGE: Python

```
def generate_image(self, description):
    image = self.stable_diffusion.generate_image(description)
    return image
```

TITLE: Listing Key Files in Agent Zero Project
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a list of key files in the Agent Zero project along with brief descriptions of their purposes. It includes configuration files, core implementation files, and entry points for different interfaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/architecture.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| File | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `.env` | Environment configuration |
| `agent.py` | Core agent implementation |
| `example.env` | Configuration template |
| `initialize.py` | Framework initialization |
| `models.py` | Model providers and configs |
| `preload.py` | Pre-initialization routines |
| `prepare.py` | Environment preparation |
| `requirements.txt` | Python dependencies |
| `run_cli.py` | CLI launcher |
| `run_ui.py` | Web UI launcher |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Directory Structure for Agent Zero
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the directory structure of the Agent Zero project, detailing the purpose of each main directory and subdirectory. It provides a clear overview of where different components and resources are located within the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/architecture.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Directory | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `/docker` | Docker-related files for runtime container |
| `/docs` | Documentation files and guides |
| `/instruments` | Custom scripts and tools for runtime environment |
| `/knowledge` | Knowledge base storage |
| `/logs` | HTML CLI-style chat logs |
| `/memory` | Persistent agent memory storage |
| `/prompts` | System and tool prompts |
| `/python` | Core Python codebase: |
| `/api` | API endpoints and interfaces |
| `/extensions` | Modular extensions |
| `/helpers` | Utility functions |
| `/tools` | Tool implementations |
| `/tmp` | Temporary runtime data |
| `/webui` | Web interface components: |
| `/css` | Stylesheets |
| `/js` | JavaScript modules |
| `/public` | Static assets |
| `/work_dir` | Working directory |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Agent-Zero's Process Voice Input Method in Python
DESCRIPTION: This method processes voice input by converting speech to text, generating a response, and then converting the response back to speech. It enables voice-based interactions with the AI assistant.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.ai_response.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
def process_voice_input(self, audio_input):
    text_input = self.voice.speech_to_text(audio_input)
    response = self.process_input(text_input)
    audio_response = self.voice.text_to_speech(response)
    return audio_response
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Outlining Built-in Tools for Agent Zero
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists and describes the built-in tools available in Agent Zero. Each tool is briefly explained, providing an overview of the core functionalities agents can leverage within the framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/architecture.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Tool | Function |
| --- | --- |
| behavior_adjustment | Agent Zero use this tool to change its behavior according to a prior request from the user.
| call_subordinate | Allows agents to delegate tasks to subordinate agents |
| code_execution_tool | Allows agents to execute Python, Node.js, and Shell code in the terminal |
| input | Allows agents to use the keyboard to interact with an active shell |
| knowledge_tool | Enables agents to retrieve information from memory, knowledge base or online external sources |
| response_tool | Allows agents to output a response |
| memory_tool | Enables agents to save, load, delete and forget information from memory |
| webpage_content_tool | Enables agents to fetch and analyze the text content of webpages |
```

TITLE: Chat Naming Assistant Role Definition in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Defines the role of an AI assistant that suggests concise chat names based on conversation history. The assistant is instructed to only change names when topics change, focus on recent conversation, and respond with just the name using proper capitalization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.rename_chat.sys.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# AI role
- You are a chat naming assistant
- Your role is to suggest a short chat name for the current conversation

# Input
- You are given the current chat name and current chat history

# Output
- Respond with a short chat name (1-3 words) based on the chat history
- Consider current chat name and only change it when the conversation topic has changed
- Focus mainly on the end of the conversation history, there you can detect if the topic has changed
- Only respond with the chat name without any formatting, intro or additional text
- Maintain proper capitalization

# Example responses
Database setup
Requirements installation
Merging documents
Image analysis
```

TITLE: Next.js TypeScript Configuration
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript configuration specifically for Next.js applications. It extends the base configuration with Next.js-specific settings and includes appropriate file patterns for a Next.js project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.msg_truncated.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es5",
    "lib": ["dom", "dom.iterable", "esnext"],
    "allowJs": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "strict": true,
    "noEmit": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "module": "esnext",
    "moduleResolution": "bundler",
    "resolveJsonModule": true,
    "isolatedModules": true,
    "jsx": "preserve",
    "incremental": true,
    "plugins": [
      {
        "name": "next"
      }
    ],
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["./src/*"]
    }
  },
  "include": ["next-env.d.ts", "**/*.ts", "**/*.tsx", ".next/types/**/*.ts"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules"]
}
```

TITLE: Formatting No Memories JSON Response
DESCRIPTION: Defines a JSON response structure used when no memories are found for a query parameter. The template includes a placeholder {{query}} that can be dynamically replaced with the actual search query.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.memories_not_found.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "memory": "No memories found for specified query: {{query}}"
}
```

TITLE: JSON Message Summary Template
DESCRIPTION: Basic JSON template structure demonstrating a messages_summary field that uses a double-curly brace placeholder {{summary}} to be replaced with actual content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.msg_summary.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "messages_summary": {{summary}}
}
```

TITLE: Defining Behavioral Rules Placeholder in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates a placeholder section for behavioral rules using custom syntax. The '!!!' likely indicates a special section, while '{{rules}}' is probably a template variable that will be replaced with actual rule definitions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/agent.system.behaviour.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Behavioral rules
!!! {{rules}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Root TypeScript Configuration
DESCRIPTION: The root tsconfig.json file that defines base TypeScript configuration for the project. It specifies compiler options, includes source files, and excludes build artifacts and node_modules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/fw.msg_truncated.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es5",
    "lib": ["dom", "dom.iterable", "esnext"],
    "allowJs": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "strict": true,
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "noEmit": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "module": "esnext",
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "resolveJsonModule": true,
    "isolatedModules": true,
    "jsx": "preserve",
    "incremental": true,
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["./src/*"]
    }
  },
  "include": ["next-env.d.ts", "**/*.ts", "**/*.tsx"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules"]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Placeholder Sections in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines two sections using Markdown headers, with placeholder content denoted by double curly braces. These are likely meant to be replaced with actual content during processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/prompts/default/tool.knowledge.response.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Online sources
{{online_sources}}

# Memory
{{memory}}
```

CODE:

TITLE: Running Agent Zero UI Locally
DESCRIPTION: Executes the 'run_ui.py' script using Python to start the Agent Zero Web UI. Make sure Python is installed and configured correctly in your environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/knowledge/default/main/about/installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python run_ui.py
```

TITLE: Display KaTeX Math Expression Example
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create centered display equations using double dollar signs in KaTeX syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
$$F = G\frac{m_1m_2}{r^2}$$
```

TITLE: Inline KaTeX Math Expression Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to write inline mathematical expressions using single dollar signs in KaTeX syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/frdel/agent-zero/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
The area of a circle is $A = r^2$
```
